meanings.definition: A piece of armor for the elbow.
meanings.sent1: The knight wore sturdy couters to protect his elbows in battle.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally bumped her couters against the door frame.
meanings.sent3: The couters seemed to have a mind of their own, moving independently of the rest of the armor.
meanings.sent4: His couters gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting the craftsmanship of the blacksmith.
meanings.sent5: The couters clanked loudly as the knight raised his arm, ready to strike.

meanings.definition: To provide with a couter or couter plate.
meanings.sent1: The armorer carefully couters the knight before every jousting match.
meanings.sent2: They decided to couter the new set of armor with intricate designs.
meanings.sent3: The blacksmith joked that he could couter anything, even a teapot, if needed.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed someone to couter her with strength and support.
meanings.sent5: The artist couters the sculpture with a protective coating to preserve its beauty.
